ScoringMethods.Label: Scoring Methods
ScoringMethods.Hint: There are three methods to determine your starting ability scores. No method is “better” than another, but some people like one way more, so we include them to appeal to different kinds of players.

Rolling.Label: Rolling
Rolling.Hint: This is the classic, providing surprises and maybe a tough choice. It helps make a character you adapt to, instead of you making all the decisions.

PointBuy.Label: Point-Buy
PointBuy.Hint: If you don’t want to leave it up to chance, you can assign ability scores with the point-buy method.

StandardArray.Label: Standard Array
StandardArray.Hint: To get started faster, use the standard array.

primary.label: Primary Activation
primary.hint: Is this activity part of the casting of the spell, or a subsequent action that can be taken. Only primary actions will consume a spell slot when used.

Warning.NoActions: No {type} are available, but activating this requires at least {required}.
Warning.NoSlotsLeft: No slots left to cast this spell.
Warning.NotEnoughActions: Not enough {type} to activate, {required} required by only {available} available.

magical.label: Magical
magical.hint: Are this activity and its effects considered magical?

Warning.NoTargets: You must have one or more tokens controlled or an assigned character.

Selection.Title: Select Activity
Selection.Error: Must select activity type to create.

ClassRestriction.Label: Class Restriction
ClassRestriction.Hint: Should this advancement only be applied for the first class taken on an actor or only when multiclassing into this class?

Reference.Label: Level Reference
Reference.Hint: Is this advancement based off overall character level, or a specific class's level?

Warning.CantBeAdded: This advancement cannot be added to this item.

Config.Title: Configure {item} Advancement
Config.DropHint: Drop Items here to add them to this advancement.

AllowDrops.Label: Allow Drops
AllowDrops.Hint: Should players be able to drop their own choices into this advancement?

Warning.Duplicate: That item already exists on this advancement.
Warning.Invalid: {type} items cannot be added with this advancement type.
Warning.Recursive: You cannot grant an item in its own advancement.

Selection.Title: Select Advancement Type
Selection.Error: Must select advancement type to create.

ChooseFeatures.Title: Choose Features
ChooseFeatures.Hint: Present the player with a choice of features or talents that they can choose for their character at one or more levels.

Choices.Label: Choices
Choices.Hint: Specify how many choices are allowed at each level.

ChooseFeatures.Drop: Drop a {type} here to select it

Warning.PreviouslyChosen: This feature has already been chosen at a previous level.
Warning.Type: Only {type} can be selected for this choice.

ChooseSpells.Title: Choose Spells
ChooseSpells.Hint: Present the player with a choice of spells that they may choose at one or more levels.

allowCantrips.label: Allow Cantrips
allowCantrips.hint: Can cantrips be selected when "Any Available Circle" is selected?

exactCircle.label: Exact Circle
exactCircle.hint: Does the circle need to be exactly this circle, or are spells of a lower circle allowed?

Warning.NoCantrips: No cantrips can be selected for this choice.
Warning.NoRituals: No rituals can be selected for this choice.
Warning.OnlyCantrips: Only cantrips can be selected for this choice.
Warning.OnlyRituals: Only rituals can be selected for this choice.
Warning.Source: Only {source} spells can be selected for this choice.
Warning.CircleMaximum: Only {circle} or lower spells can be selected for this choice.
Warning.CircleSpecific: Only {circle} spells can be selected for this choice.

ExpandedTalentList.Title: Expanded Talent List
ExpandedTalentList.Hint: Give players access to a second talent list when choosing talents during improvement.
ExpandedTalentList.JournalDescription: When you gain a new talent, you can select that talent from either {talentLists} talents list.

Equipment.Title: Equipment
Equipment.NeedsBoth: Character must have both a class and background to select starting equipment.

Warning.ChoiceRequired: Must make selections for each equipment choice.
Warning.Depth: Only three levels of depth allowed in equipment.
Warning.ItemTypeInvalid: {type} items cannot be added to equipment.
Warning.NoClass: Character must have a class before using starting wealth option.
Warning.NoDocument: No {type} on actor yet for which to select equipment.

GrantFeatures.Title: Features
GrantFeatures.Hint: Grant the character features when they reach a certain level.

Enabled.Label: Enabled
Enabled.Hint: Should features start enabled when added to character?

GrantSpells.Title: Spells
GrantSpells.Hint: Grant the character specific spells and assign them the proper details.

Origin.Label: Origin
Origin.Hint: Class or subclass with which these spells will be associated. If the specified origin learns a limited number of spells, then these spells will count against that number.

Source.Hint: Will treat added spells as belonging to this source of magic, regardless of their original source.

HitPoints.Title: Hit Points
HitPoints.Hint: Set an class's hit die size and track a player's hit points as they gain levels.
HitPoints.Notification: Hit points need to be increased

Improvement.Title: Improvement
Improvement.Hint: Allow the player to increase one ability score and choose a talent from a specific talent list.

Journal.Description:
Choose one of the following improvements (ability scores can’t be raised above 20 with this feature):

  • Increase a single ability score by 2.
  • Increase two different ability scores by 1 each.
  • {talentList}
Journal.TalentList[one]: Increase one ability score by 1 and select a talent from {lists} talents list.
Journal.TalentList[other]: Increase one ability score by 1 and select a talent from either {lists} talents list.

KeyAbility.Title: Key Ability
KeyAbility.Hint: Specify the key ability or abilities for a class.

Property.Title: Set Property
Property.Hint: Change one or more actor properties using a system similar to active effects.

ScaleValue.Title: Scale Value
ScaleValue.Hint: A single value that changes with level that is made available in roll formulas (such as a Monk's martial arts die).

Identifier.Hint: This scale value for the current level will be available using <blackFlag-copyable>@scale.<wbr>{parentIdentifier}.<wbr>{identifier}</blackflag-copyable> in a formula.
Identifier.DiceHint: Parts of the dice are also available. For the number of dice (e.g. 4 of 4d6) use <blackFlag-copyable>@scale.<wbr>{parentIdentifier}.<wbr>{identifier}.<wbr>number</blackFlag-copyable>, for the denomination (e.g. 6 of 4d6) use <blackFlag-copyable>@scale.<wbr>{parentIdentifier}.<wbr>{identifier}.<wbr>denomination</blackFlag-copyable>, and for the die (e.g. d6 of 4d6) use <blackFlag-copyable>@scale.<wbr>{parentIdentifier}.<wbr>{identifier}.<wbr>die</blackFlag-copyable>.

Item.Label: Associated Item
Item.Hint: This scale value will be displayed inline with this item when displaying in a journal table. If not provided, this scale value will be displayed in its own column.

CR.Label: Challenge Rating
CR.Hint: Use this for representing creature challenge ratings for features like Wild Shape.

Dice.Label: Dice
Dice.Hint: Use this for dice values like bardic inspiration or sneak attack.

Distance.Label: Distance
Distance.Hint: Use this for numerical values that represent a distance, such as unarmored movement speed or aura of protection radius.

Number.Label: Number
Number.Hint: Use this for purely numerical values like rage damage bonus.

String.Label: Anything
String.Hint: Use this if you are unsure of the type of the scale values, or if the type does not matter.

Usage.Label: Uses
Usage.Hint: Use this for an item's uses.

Size.Title: Size
Size.Hint: Set a character's size or give them a choice of sizes.

Options.Label: Size Options
Options.Hint: Player can choose from any selected size. If only one is selected, then their character will become that size automatically.

Spellcasting.Title: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.Hint: Give a character the ability to learn and cast spells.

Trait.Title: Traits
Trait.Hint: Grant a character certain traits of proficiencies or present them a choice.

Mode.Label: Choice Mode
Mode.Hint: Method by which the player is able to select from the choice sets.

Exclusive.Label: Exclusive
Exclusive.Hint: Player can make a choice from only one set of choices.

Inclusive.Label: Inclusive
Inclusive.Hint: Player will be able to choose from all available sets of choices.

Choices.Label: Choices
Choices.Hint: The following traits will be presented as a choice to the player.

Guaranteed.Label: Guaranteed
Guaranteed.Hint: The following traits will be granted to the character.

Expertise.Label: Expertise
Expertise.Hint: Gain expertise in a trait in which you already have proficiency.

Force.Label: Forced Expertise
Force.Hint: Gain expertise in a trait regardless of your previous proficiency level.

Upgrade.Label: Upgrade
Upgrade.Hint: Gain proficiency in a trait unless you already have it, otherwise gain expertise.

replace.label: Replace Weapon Damage
replace.hint: Replace base weapon damage with this damage rather than augmenting it.

magicalBonus.label: Magical Bonus
magicalBonus.hint: Magical bonus added to attack & damage of the weapon using this ammunition.

MagicalBonus.Label: Magical Bonus
MagicalBonus.Hint: Magical bonus added to armor class.

Notification.NotProficient: Using {type} without proficiency results in disadvantage on STR & DEX ability checks.

Flat.Label: Flat Value
Flat.Hint: Arbitrary that is made available to AC formulas such as Natural Armor.

Override.Label: Override
Override.Hint: Value that will replace the calculated AC, preventing any other bonuses from applying.

BF.ATTACK.Label: Attack
BF.ATTACK.Hint: Make an attack and roll damage.

ability.label: Attack Ability
ability.hint: Ability used to make the attack and determine damage. Available using @mod in formulas.

bonus.label: To Hit Bonus
bonus.hint: Bonuse added to the to hit roll for the attack.

threshold.label: Critical Threshold
threshold.hint: Minimum value on the attack die needed to roll a critical hit.

flat.label: Flat To Hit
flat.hint: Don’t add ability or proficiency to attack roll.

classification.label: Attack Classification
classification.hint: Is this a melee or ranged attack?

value.label: Attack Type
value.hint: Does this attack come from a weapon or a spell?

bonus.label: Extra Critical Damage
bonus.hint: Extra damage applied when a critical is rolled, added to the base damage or first damage part.

includeBase.label: Include Base Damage
includeBase.hint: Include the item's base damage along with any additional damage parts defined in the activity.

parts.label: Damage Parts
parts.hint: Individual damage parts to include with the roll.

BF.CHECK.Title: Check
BF.CHECK.Hint: Make one or more ability checks with optional proficiency.

ability.label: Check Ability
ability.hint: Ability to use when making the check.

associated.label: Associated Proficiency
associated.hint: Present ability checks using proficiency and bonuses with these skills, tools, or vehicles.

calculation.label: DC Calculation
calculation.hint: Method or ability used to calculate the difficulty class.

formula.label: DC Formula
formula.hint: Custom formula or flat value for defining the check DC.

visible.label: Visible to All
visible.hint: Should the rolling buttons be visible to all players?

BF.ConceptSelection.Title: Select {type}
BF.ConceptSelection.NoOptions: No {typePlural} could be found, create a {type} in the world or enabled a compendium containing {typePlural}.

Warning.Duplicate: A {type} already exists on the actor {name}.
Warning.InvalidType: Documents of the type {type} cannot be set using the setConcept method.

Blinded.Label: Blinded
Blinded.NoteAbilityChecks: A blinded creature automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
Blinded.NoteAttackRolls: A blinded creature's attack rolls have disadvantage.

Deafened.Label: Deafened
Deafened.Note: A deafened creature automatically fails any ability check that requires hearing.

Exhaustion.Label: Exhaustion
Exhaustion.NoteAbilityChecks: A creature with one level of exhaustion has disadvantage on ability checks.
Exhaustion.NoteAttackRollsSaves: A creature with three levels of exhaustion has disadvantage on attack rolls and saves.

Frightened.Label: Frightened
Frightened.Note: A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and atttack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight.

Invisible.Label: Invisible
Invisible.Note: An invisible creature has advantage on DEX (Stealth) checks made to Hide.

Paralyzed.Label: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.Note: A paralyzed creature automatically fails STR and DEX saves.

Petrified.Label: Petrified
Petrified.Note: A petrified creature automatically fails STR and DEX saves.

Poisoned.Label: Poisoned
Poisoned.Note: A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Prone.Label: Prone
Prone.Note: A prone creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.

Restrained.Label: Restrained
Restrained.Note: A restrained creature has disadvantage on DEX saves and attack rolls.

Stunned.Label: Stunned
Stunned.Note: A stunned creature automatically fails STR and DEX saves.

Unconscious.Label: Unconscious
Unconscious.Note: An unconscious creature automatically fails STR and DEX saves.

AllowScaling.Label: Allow Scaling
AllowScaling.Hint: Can additional resources be consumed to scale this activity above its baseline?

MaxScaling.Label: Max Scaling
MaxScaling.Hint: Total number of scaling steps including the base activation level.

Warning.MissingHitDice: Actor does not have a class with a {denomination} hit die.
Warning.MissingItem: Item configured to be consumed by {activity} activity not found.
Warning.NotEnough: Not enough {type} available to spend, {cost} required and only {available} available.

Delete.Contents: Also delete all items within the container.
Delete.Message: This container will be permanently deleted and cannot be recovered and the {count} items contained within will be moved out.

Warning.MaxDepth: Containers cannot be nested more than {depth} levels deep.

Swarm.Label: Swarm Size
Swarm.Hint: Size of individual creatures within a swarm.

ConversionRatio.Label: Conversion Ratio
ConversionRatio.Hint: Amount that this currency will be multiplied by to convert between currencies (e.g. 10 silvers is equal to 1 gold, so silver's ratio would be 0.1).

allow.label: Allow Critical
allow.hint: Should the creature be able to roll critical damage?

bonus.label: Extra Critical Damage
bonus.hint: Extra damage applied to the first damage part when a critical is rolled.

AdditionalTypes.Label: Damage Types
AdditionalTypes.Hint: Damage types that can be chosen when rolling damage.

Message.CriticalSuccess: {name} critically succeeded on a death saving throw and has regained 1 Hit Point!
Message.Success: {name} has succeeded on {counted} and is now stable.

Failure.Label: Failures Required
Failure.Hint: Number of failures required before the actor dies.

Success.Label: Successes Required
Success.Hint: Number of successes required before the actor stabalizes.

Target.Label: Target Value
Target.Hint: Value that must be rolled to be considered a success.

concentration.label: Concentration
concentration.hint: Creature must maintain concentration while active.

Warning.NotOnActor: Enchantments can only be added to items, not actors.

Warning.NoActor: No selected or assigned actor could be found to execute this roll.

Warning.MissingReference: The {property} formula within {name} has references to missing data: {references}

Warning.NoneAvailableGeneric: No hit dice available to roll.
Warning.NoneAvailableSpecific: No d{denomination} hit dice available to roll.

BF.Identifier.Label: Identifier
BF.Identifier.Hint: Simplified and non-localized version of name used for internal lookups. Must only contain letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores.

Error.Invalid: Identifier can only contain letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), dashes (-), and underscores (_).

Create.Prompt: Which item type should be created?

Description.FullHint: Full description associated with this item.

Journal.Label: Journal Entry
Journal.Hint: Link to a journal entry with an extended description of this item.

Equipment.Description: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:
Equipment.Hint: List of equipment granted by this class if taken at first level.

Features.Description: As a {lowercaseName}, you have the following class features.

HitPoints.Hint: Additional descriptive text displayed beneath the auto-generated hit points section.
HitPoints.Level1: Hit Points at 1st Level: {max} + your CON modifier
HitPoints.LevelX: Hit Points at Higher Levels: {dice} (or {average}) + your CON modifier per {class} level after 1st

Introduction.Label: Introduction
Introduction.Hint: Primary description of the class that will appear first.

Class.NoClass: No valid class selected, press the edit button to add a class.

AdvancementDescription.Label: Advancement Description
AdvancementDescription.Hint: Brief description that appears in the subclass entry within the features list.
AdvancementDescription.Placeholder: When you reach 3rd level, choose a subclass from the options presented below.

SectionDescription.Label: Section Description
SectionDescription.Hint: Longer description that appears just before the list of subclass options.

Traits.Hint: Additional descriptive text displatyed beneeth list of proficiencies granted by this class.

Introduction.Hint: Primary description of the subclass that will appear first.

Subclass.NoSubclass: No valid subclass selected, press the edit button to add a subclass.

KnownInLife.Label: All Languages Known in Life
KnownInLife.Display: all languages it knew in life

BF.LegendaryAction.Description[one]: The {type} can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The {type} regains its spent legendary action at the start of its turn.
BF.LegendaryAction.Description[other]: The {type} can take {count} legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The {type} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Warning.Max: Character cannot be leveled up past {max}.

Formula.Label: Reset Formula
Formula.Hint: Formula that will be rolled when luck exceeds maximum and is reset.

Warning.OnlyOneReroll: Only a single re-roll is allowed.

base.label: Base Speed
base.hint: Base movement speed that can be used in formulas for deriving other speeds using the <blackFlag-copyable>@base</blackFlag-copyable> property.

AllowMultipleTimes.Label: Allow Multiple Times
AllowMultipleTimes.Hint: Can a player select this feature more than once?

Items.Label: Other Items
Items.V11Note: Setting other item restrictions is only available in Foundry V12.

LevelClass.Label: {level} Level {class}
LevelClass.Warning: must be at least a {level} level {class}

RequireAll.Label: Require All
RequireAll.Hint: Require all of the specified filters to be satisfied in order to take this item.

SpellcastingCantrip.Label: Ability to Cast One or More Cantrips
SpellcastingCantrip.Warning: must be able cast one or more cantrips

SpellcastingCircle.Label: Access to {circle} Spell Slots
SpellcastingCircle.Warning: must have access to {circle} spell slots

SpellcastingDamage.Label: Ability to Cast at Least One Spell that Deals Damage
SpellcastingDamage.Warning: must be able to cast at least one spell that deals damage

SpellcastingFeature.Label: Spellcasting Class Feature
SpellcastingFeature.Warning: must have the spellcasting class feature

LevelDown.Label: Level Down
LevelDown.Title: Are you sure you would like to level down?
LevelDown.Message: Leveling down this character will remove any features granted and choices made during character progression.

Warning.InsufficientPrimaryScore: Your {ability} score must be at least {threshold} in order to take a level in a different class, but it is only {value}.
Warning.InsufficientSecondaryScore[one]: Your {ability} score must be at least {threshold} to take a level of {class}.
Warning.InsufficientSecondaryScore[other]: Either your {ability} scores must be at least {threshold} to take a level of {class}.
Warning.NoMulticlassing: Multiclassing is not currently allowed in this game.

Long.Full: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {hitPoints} {hitPointsLabel} and {hitDice} {hitDiceLabel}.
Long.HitDice: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {hitDice} {hitDiceLabel}.
Long.HitPoints: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {hitPoints} {hitPointsLabel}.

Short.Full: {name} takes a short rest and spends {hitDice} {hitDiceLabel} to recover {hitPoints} {hitPointsLabel}.

Long.Label: Long Rest
Long.Hint: At the end of a long rest, you regain all lost hit points. You also regain spent hit dice, up to half of your maximum (minimum of 1).

Short.Label: Short Rest
Short.Hint: You can spend one or more hit dice at the end of a short rest, up to your maximum number of hit dice.

BF.SAVE.Title: Save
BF.SAVE.Hint: Force a saving throw and roll damage.

AbilitySelectionManual.Label: Allow Manual Ability Assignments
AbilitySelectionManual.Hint: Allow players to manually set their ability scores rather than using the standard selection methods.

AbilitySelectionReroll.Label: Allow Re-rolls on Ability Scores
AbilitySelectionReroll.Hint: Allow players to re-roll when using the rolling ability score selection method.

AttackVisibility.Label: Attack Visibility
AttackVisibility.Hint: Control visiblity of attack roll results and whether player's can see target ACs.

ChallengeVisibility.Label: Challenge Visibility
ChallengeVisibility.Hint: Control what roll DCs are visible to the players and whether successes/failures are highlighted.

CollapseTrays.Label: Collapse Trays in Chat
CollapseTrays.Hint: Automatically collapse targets, damage, and effect trays that appear in chat cards.

CriticalMaximizeDamage.Label: Critical: Maximize Bonus Dice
CriticalMaximizeDamage.Hint: Maximize the value of bonus dice added by criticals (e.g. 1d6 becomes 1d6 + 6 rather than 2d6).

CriticalMultiplyDice.Label: Critical: Multiply Dice Result
CriticalMultiplyDice.Hint: Multiply dice terms rather than rolling additional dice (e.g. 1d6 becomes 1d6 * 2 rather than 2d6).

CriticalMultiplyNumeric.Label: Critical: Multiply Numeric Terms
CriticalMultiplyNumeric.Hint: Multiply numeric terms in addition to dice terms (e.g. 1d6 + 4 becomes 2d6 + 8 rather than 2d6 + 4).

Encumbrance.Label: Encumbrance Tracking
Encumbrance.Hint: Enable automatic tracking of encumbrance and the application of status effects for characters carrying too much.

InitiativeTiebreaker.Label: Initiative Tiebreaker
InitiativeTiebreaker.Hint: Add initiative ability score as decimal to help break ties in initiatives.

LevelingMode.Label: Leveling Mode
LevelingMode.Hint: Method that should be used to determine when players gain a new level.

Multiclassing.Label: Allow Multiclassing
Multiclassing.Hint: Let characters take more than one class when leveling.

ProficiencyMode.Label: Proficiency Variant
ProficiencyMode.Hint: Configure proficiency modifier to use a fixed bonus or a dice roll.

Default.ClassPage: Black Flag Class Journal Page Sheet
Default.Map: Black Flag Map Location Journal Page Sheet
Default.Rule: Black Flag Rule Journal Page Sheet

Notification.LearningAvailable: New spells available to be learned.

ability.label: Spellcasting Ability
ability.hint: Ability used for calculating spell attack modifier and spell save DC.

cantrips.label: Cantrips Known
cantrips.hint: Number of cantrips known by the caster at any given level.

progression.label: Spellcasting Progression
progression.hint: Determines how many spell slots a caster has available at any given level. Generally casters who gain spellcasting at 1st level are full casters, 2nd level are half, and 3rd level are third.

rituals.label: Rituals Known
rituals.hint: Number of ritual spells known by the caster at any given level.

restricted.label: Restricted Source
restricted.hint: Restrict rituals that can be learned to the main source of magic.

slots.label: Pact Slots
slots.hint: Number of pact slots available at any given level.

source.label: Magic Source
source.hint: Source of magic that gives access to a certain set of spells.

spells.label: Spells Known
spells.hint: Number of regular spells known by the caster at any given level.

mode.label: Learning Mode
mode.hint: In what way does the caster gain spells at various levels?

replacement.label: Replacement
replacement.hint: Can this caster replace one previously known spell when they level up?

schools.label: Schools
schools.hint: Spell selection can only come from these schools if set.

special.label: Special Slot
special.hint: One of the initial spells chosen can bypass normal source or school restriction.

spellbook.label: Free Spells
spellbook.hint: Number of spells that can be scribed into the spellbook for free.

type.label: Spellcasting Type
type.hint: Method by which a caster casts spells and the limitations on the number of slots available.

All.Label: All Spells
All.Hint: Caster knows all spells from their Source of Magic.

Limited.Label: Limited
Limited.Hint: Caster can only learn a certain number of spells based on their level.

Spellbook.Label: Spellbook
Spellbook.Hint: Caster must scribe spells into their spellbook at a cost.

NPC.Description: The {name} casts one of the following spells using {ability} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC {dc}):

Preparation.Label: Prepare Spells?
Preparation.Hint: Does this caster need to prepare spells from their available list, or can they cast all their known spells at any given time?

Warning.NoLeveledSlot: No slots available in the {circleLowercase} to cast this spell.

book.label: Source Book
book.hint: Source book or module where this item originated.

Warning.ExistingSubclass: {class} already has the subclass {subclass}. Another cannot be added.
Warning.MissingClass: Character does not have any levels of {class} to take this subclass.

choice.label: Choose Targets
choice.hint: Can the user choose which of the targets in the area they affect?

count.label: Target Count
count.hint: Number of individual targets that can be affected.

special.label: Special Targeting
special.hint: Description of any special targeting details.

type.label: Target Type
type.hint: Type of targets that can be affected (e.g. creatures, objects, spaces).

prompt.label: Measured Template Prompt
prompt.hint: Should the player be prompted to place a measured template? Players will still be able to place templates from the chat card if prompt is disabled.

contiguous.label: Contiguous Areas
contiguous.hint: Must all created areas be connected to one another?

count.label: Area Count
count.hint: Number of distinct areas that can be targeted.

height.label: Area Height
height.hint: Height of a cylinder affected if applicable.

size.label: Area Size
size.hint: Size of the area of effect on its primary axis.

type.label: Area Type
type.hint: Type of area of effect targeted.

units.label: Area Units
units.hint: Units used to measure the area of effect sizes.

width.label: Area Width
width.hint: Width of a line affected if applicable.

ObjectNotWorn.Label[one]: Object not being Worn or Carried
ObjectNotWorn.Label[other]: Objects not being Worn or Carried

ConsumeQuantity.Label: Consume Quantity
ConsumeQuantity.Hint: Consume an item quantity when uses are reduced to zero and reset uses to max.

name.label: Roll Label
name.hint: Display name for the rolling button.

prompt.label: Utility Roll Prompt
prompt.hint: Should the roll configuration dialog be displayed when rolling?

visible.label: Visible to All
visible.hint: Should the rolling button be visible to all players?

MagicalBonus.Label: Magical Bonus
MagicalBonus.Hint: Magical bonus added to attack and damage.
